result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery P Laqua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must call Probation today to report (2/22/22).

miscConds.notes: $200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount prescribed.

No drug paraphernalia.

No contact with known drug users or dealers unless in a treatment setting or in confinement.

Must complete any treatment or programming required by agent.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Must enroll in assessment within 60 days.
Must complete a Mental Health Evaluation and comply with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery P Laqua

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 21CF339 & 22CF12. 11:31 AM Defendant Jeffery P Laqua in court with attorney Donna Burger. Defendant Jeffery P Laqua in custody. David Stilin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. ADA to file  amended informations. Copy provided to defense and court. Felony warnings given. 
In 21CF339 count 1- def- G plea. 
In 22CF12 count 1- def- G plea. Count 2 felony bail jumping- def- G plea.
CT accepts pleas, adj G on each.  In 21CF339 and 22CF12 remaining counts are RI&D on state's motion. Def requests to waive PSI. Counsel stipulates to waiver.  Arguments. Counsel stipulates to credit on 22CF12: 42 days credit and 21CF339: 159 days. 

SENTENCE
21CF339 count 1: 
W/held sent 4 years probation. Probation conditions on all: AODA and comply. Must be enrolled within 60 days. Mental health evaluation and comply with all recommendations for treatment. $290.60 fine/costs, $250 DNA sucharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. 159 days credit. 12 months banked jail for probation to use. Not subj to good time. If def objects any request for banked jail, def must file written request for hearing within 5 days. No controlled substances without a prescription. No drug paraphernalia. No contact with known drug users or dealers unless in treatment setting or in confinement. Any treatment or programming required by agent.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.  Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 

22CF12:
Count 1: W/held sent 1 year probation. Fine waived. $200 DNA sucharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. Same probation conditions as other case. 

Count 2: W/held sent 4 years probation. Fine waived. $250 DNA sucharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. 42 days credit. 
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.  Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. Must call probation today to report. PCR. 12:04 pm adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea hearing on March 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

CASES: ARGN in 22CF12 & STC in 21CF339. Attorney Donna Burger in court for Defendant Jeffery P Laqua. Prosecuting Atty David Stilin appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeffery P Laqua appeared by video means from the Polk County Jail. 2:59 p.m. AO-Clerk. 22CF12 - Atty Burger preserved on all prearraignment rights for 15 days. Atty Burger - waive reading, plea NG. Bond cont. 3:05 p.m. adj.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Burger - WOPH.  CT questions Def & accepts waiver.  CT - Def is bound over.

Cases:  21CF339, 22CF12.  Defendant Jeffery P Laqua in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Defendant Jeffery P Laqua in custody.  David Stilin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffery P Laqua appeared by video means from the PCJ.  BJM-clerk  2:07 pm

21CF339:  Bond cont. 
22CF12 (AIA):  CT - bond already set.

2:10 pm adj.  Arraignment scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

BOND COVERS CASES: 22CF12 & 21CF339. Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. Not to possess drug paraphernalia. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Complete compliance with mental health regimen.

CASES: 22CF12 & 21CF339. 01:07 PM Defendant Jeffery P Laqua appeared by video means from PCJ, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius appeared by video means. David Stilin appeared for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Initial Appr 22CF12, Return on warrant 21CF339. 
Init Appr 22CF12: Waives reading. ADA requests $1000 cash bond. Atty Burger represents def on other file. 
21CF339: Warrant quashed. 
CT sets bond to cover both files. Def is advised of options to obtain counsel. Def to contact PD's office about representation. May file petition for court appointed attorney if he does not qualify for PD and unable to hire own counsel. Phone number will be provided to def. 1:19 pm adj. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
